Ajit Vadakayil<br />\nApril 7, 2015 at 6:59 PM<br />\nhi p,<br />\n<br />\nYOU DO NOT WANT ANY INDIAN HEROES LEFT STANDING OR WHAT ?<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\">WHILE IN JAIL BHAGAT SINGH WROTE A MERCY PETITION FOR PLEA BARGAIN ( LIKE VEER SAVARKAR )</span></b> . &nbsp; &nbsp;THIS IS GONNA SHAKE EVERY DESH BHAKT , RIGHT ?<br />\n<br />\nBIJOY KUMAR SINHA IS WITNESS.<br />\n<br />\nTHE DIARY OF BHAGAT SINGH WAS GHOST WRITTEN .<br />\n<br />\nWHY ELSE SHOULD HE PRAISE ROTHSCHILD BLOOD RELATIVE GERMAN JEW KARL MARX, JEW TROTSKY, JEW LENIN, JEW FRIEDRICH ENGELS etc IN HIS DIARY ?<br />\n<br />\nWHEN PEOPLE COULD NOT FIND THE DEAD BODY OF BHAGAT SINGH AFTER HANGING THERE WAS A HUGE UPROAR.<br />\n<br />\nEVR PERIYAR TRANSLATED \u201c WHY I AM AN ATHEIST \u201c INTO TAMIL \u2013 TO SCREW HINDUSIM.<br />\n<br />\nAfter the death of Bhagat Singh, the essay was published on 27 September 1931 in DEAD MEN TELL NO TALES Lala Lajpat Rai's English weekly The People\u2014to make it authentic.<br />\n<br />\nbhagat singh was NOT hanged as written by gandhi and as per the fake stamped and signed death deed of the british--<br />\n<br />\nwhere the time of hanging is penned down as 23rd march 1931- lahore jail at 1930 hrs.<br />\n<br />\nTHIS IS AN IMMORAL AND FOUL LIE - WITH GANDHI IN CAHOOTS.<br />\n<br />\nBHAGAT SINGH WAS KILLED WITH BULLETS ( WE MUST IMAGINE THIS ) .<br />\n<br />\nthere was no white magistrate to supervise his hanging on that date and time as a large angry crows was all around the jail perimeter with torches and fires.<br />\n<br />\nthere was NO live or dead body of bhagat singh and his 2 colleagues at that time within the jail perimeter walls .<br />\n<br />\nthe crowd collected only because it was reported that the wall behind the jail was breached and hastily repaired.<br />\n<br />\nbhagat singh's dead body was DOUSED IN KEROSENE AND SET ON FIRE-- contrary to the tenets of his religion.<br />\n<br />\nas is required by british law , no POST MORTEM was done .<br />\n<br />\ntheir bodies NOT handed over to their relatives for last rituals but instead the gory charred remains were chopped up and thrown into the sutlej river.<br />\n<br />\nthere were witnesses of even dogs refusing to eat some of these floating remains on the river banks.<br />\n<br />\nIn the 29 March 1931 issue of Young India, ILLUMINATI and Rothschild stooge Gandhi wrote:<br />\n\"Bhagat Singh and his two associates have been hanged. The Congress made many attempts to save their lives and the Government entertained many hopes of it, but all has been in a vain. \"<br />\n<br />\n\"Bhagat Singh did not wish to live. He refused to apologize, or even file an appeal. Bhagat Singh was not a devotee of non-violence- we should not imitate their act. In our land of millions of destitute and crippled people, if we take to the practice of seeking justice through murder, there will be a terrifying situation. Our poor people will become victims of our atrocities. By making a dharma of violence, we shall be reaping the fruit of our own actions.<br />\nHence, though we praise the courage of these brave men, we should never countenance their activities. Our dharma is to swallow our anger, abide by the discipline of non-violence and carry out our duty\"<br />\n<br />\nMY DEAR INDIANS --THIS IS THE FATHER OF OUR NATION SPEAKING !<br />\n<br />\nwhy did bhagat singh go on the path of violence?<br />\n<br />\nhe avenged his own father s kishen singh -- who was accused of the british of putting BLUE INK MARKS on the chest of lala lajpat rai -- see these marks were NOT due to lathi beatings-- but fake marks made by ink.<br />\n<br />\nLALA LAJPAT RAI, THE LION OF PUNJAB VADAKAYIL<br />\n<br />\nit is best that i speak no further-<br />\n<br />\nalready I have proved that Tantia tope and Bhagat singh were NOT hanged as per historical records.<br />\n<br />\nCapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_11BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; Alright I tell you. Charles Darwin has tried to throw some light on the subject. Study him. Read Soham Swam's \"Commonsense\". It shall answer your question to some extent. This is a phenomenon of nature. The accidental mixture of different substances in the shape of nebulace produced this earth. When ? Consult history. The same process produced animals and in the long run man. Read Darwin's 'Origin of Species'. And all the later progress is due to man's constant conflict with nature and his efforts to override it. This is the briefest possible explanation of this phenomenon.\"<br />\nWas he really aware of human consciousness or an innocent young martyr? font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE : <span style=\"color: blue;\">The strength of\nCommunism is not so much in India\u2026 During the War, Communists supported [British\nalien] Government and it helped them. They built up their strength with the\nhelp of the [British] Government. Since our release [July 1945] and holding the\nreins of Government, they have received a set-back. The Razakars [in Hyderabad\nsupported by the Nizam] gave them some arms, but I do not think they will be\nable to do much with them. They will not be able to stand long. We are capable\nof handling them there\u2026 Their object has been to create dislocation and\ndisruption. We cannot allow the breakdown of Government or organised machinery\nby force or coercion.&nbsp; I do not think\nCommunism has much chance in India. The reason is they did not help the\nStruggle for Freedom but took advantage of it to consolidate themselves. They\nhave thus created a considerable resentment against them. The general tendency\n[in India] is against any foreign element in the body-politic of India: </span>&nbsp;UNQUOTE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">K.M.Munshi, then\nIndia\u2019s Agent-General in Hyderabad and one Sardar Patel\u2019s chief lieutenants in\nthe entire operation had this to say- <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\">QUOTE: \u201c In May 1948\u2026The\nCommunist Party of Hyderabad issued a pamphlet reversing their earlier policy.\nThe accession of Hyderabad to the Union and responsible Government in the State\nwere denounced on the ground that the Government of India was a capitalist\ngovernment. To maintain a show of consistency, it was suggested that before\nreal freedom was achieved, feudalism had also to be liquidated. The reports\nindicated that not only was there some understanding between the Nizam\u2019s\nGovernment and the Communists, but explosives were in process of being supplied\nto the Razakars by the Communists from West Bengal. \u2026 According to their new\npropaganda line the accession of the Indian States to the Union was a gross\nanti-democratic act calculated to crush the revolutionary consciousness and the\ndemocratic movement of the people. If the Indian Armies marched into Hyderabad,\nit would be to crush the people\u2019s movement. They exhorted their workers to\nresist the movement of the troops wherever the people\u2019s Government \u2013 that is,\ntheir little Soviets holding the villages by terror, murder and arson \u2013 was\nestablished. UNQUOTE<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\">QUOTE: The activities\nof the Communists and the Razakars between March 1948 and 17<sup>th</sup> Sept\n1938 &nbsp;imposed a heavy burden on the\npeople, through forcible collection of subscriptions; land grabbing, burning of\nvillages and village land registry records; looting of property; murder of\nsuspects, hostiles and village land registry officers; attack on police\nstations, home-guards and officers and men, and the destruction of police\nstations to burn FIR records: UNQUOTE</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It clearly says that\nthe Indian Commie and the Razakars were comrades in arms before Operation Polo.\n&nbsp;It is only after Nizams surrendered that\nthe Indian commie started killing their former friends, the Razakars ,and\nkilling Muslim landlords to grab their lands.&nbsp;\nThe Commie historians have buried the truth . The truth is now exhumed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is what &nbsp;D.P.Mishra, a stalwart of the freedom\nstruggle, an active participant in post-independent India\u2019s politics, observed\nthus in his memoir of the \u201cNehru Epoch\u201d in Indian politics:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">QUOTE\u2026When in the wake\nof independence, mass murders and migrations, and later the Kashmir problem,\nmade the first government of independent India vulnerable, the Communists found\ntheir opportunity and by a series of bloody insurrections tried to smash and\nreplace what they called bourgeois democracy by socialist democracy\u2026They\nplanned to develop a mass movement by their violent activities throughout the\ncountry, hoping that these would culminate in people themselves taking up arms\nto throw out the government. But Home Minister Patel acted swiftly and the\nCommunist design was almost nipped in the bud. Very soon their violence lost\nits fury and force and the planned mass insurrections degenerated into\nterrorist activities .UNQUOTE</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>&nbsp;\u201cVijayawada was the focal centre of an area\nthat covered the old Krishna, Guntur and Nellore districts of the Madras\nprovince, which saw the birth of the Communist movement in Andhra Pradesh.\nVarious struggles against zamindari landlordism took place here during the\n1936-38 period, such as the struggles against the Challapalli, Munagala and\nKalipatnam zamindars.\"<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; Sundarayya, M.\nBasavapunnaiah, C. Rajeswara Rao, N. Prasada Rao, M. Hanumantha Rao, L.B.\nGangadhara Rao, Koratala Satyanarayana and many others\u201d</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Oh yes, the present\ndays ex-JNU commies know what happened. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Just in case you want\nto know why Wildon Bezwada was given the Magsaysay award this year.&nbsp; Bezwada ( old name of Vijayawada ) was the\nbiggest hub of commie activity in India.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bezwada was the home of Prajasakti,&nbsp;\nthe Communist daily , the Communist Party\u2019s City&nbsp; Committee office and the offices of the\nKrishna District Committee and the Andhra Provincial&nbsp; Committee of the Party.&nbsp; Every time police had to make arrests Bezwada\nwas the first place to swoop down. Even today in Vijayawada commie gangs\nterrorise all.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Kamma crypto Jew commie\nleaders had foreign fund support.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Puran Chand Joshi was\nthe first general secretary of the Communist Party of India from 1935\u201347. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1934 the CPI was\nadmitted to the Third International or Comintern. &nbsp;&nbsp;He\nprovided arms and ammunition to the Telugu commies from Russia and commie\nmilitary officers of the Indian army. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This tradition of secretly\nsourcing arms and ammunition from traitor commie officers in the Indian army continued\n.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1962, just before\nthe India China war Nikita Khrushchev told Nehru the names of the current traitor\nIndian army Commie officers and all of them were thrown into jail and punished\nseverely..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In submissions to Sir\nReginald,&nbsp; PC Joshi showed what a\nsplendid job he and his party were doing to break up and sabotage the Quit\nIndia Movement , in writing. &nbsp;&nbsp;After the\n1942 Quit India movement was crushed PC Joshi wrote a letter to the King George\nVI congratulating her.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">K.K. Chaudhari in his\nBook Quit India Revolution: The Ethos of Its Central Direction: wrote &nbsp;\"On many occasions the Communists were\nindeed more royalist&nbsp; than even the King\nof England\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chaudhari writes that\nthe 120-page report \"could not have been improved by any other\ncollaborator of the British or by any quisling\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The&nbsp;</span><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">Rothschild</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;controlled atheist Commies wrote that \u201cthe demand for Pakistan is a just and\ndemocratic one&nbsp;because Hindus would oppress them in future\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The diaries of former\nSoviet Ambassador to India IA Benediktov give a good Insight on various acts of\nCPI.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Benediktov diaries\nform part of the Russian Archives Documents Database at the National Security\nArchive of George Washington University, Washington, DC. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Excerpts from the\ndiaries can be accessed on the website of the Cold War International History\nProject of the Woodrow Wilson Centre in Washington, DC.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One of entries describe\na conversation with the Secretary of the National Council of the Communist\nParty of India (CPI), Bhupesh Gupta. During the conversation, Gupta urgently\nrequests Soviet financial aid for the Indian party for use in an upcoming\nelection campaign; the answer conveyed by Benediktov ten days later suggests\nthat the Soviets responded positively to the request, although the amount is\nnot indicated:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Followed by:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Today I received Gupta\nat his request. Gupta communicated that on 16-17 January a meeting of the\nSecretariat of the CPI took place in Delhi, at which was discussed the future\nwork of the party apparatus in connection with the death of A[joy]. [Kumar] Ghosh\u2026.Gupta\nsaid that he desires that the ties of the CPI and CPSU do not become weakened\nin any way after the death of Ghosh. The assistance in various forms and the\ncomradely advice of the CC CPSU have always been enormously useful to us, he\nunderscored\u2026.Gupta said that no other party, not even the communist party of\nChina, can occupy in the hearts of Indian communists the place which belongs to\nthe CPSU\u2026<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gupta reported that\nafter the death of Ghosh at the present time in the party there is an acute\ninsufficiency of means for the preelection campaign. He expressed the fear that\nwith the death of Ghosh the source for receiving means for the communist party\nfrom the CPSU might be closed. These questions were handled by Ghosh alone,\nGupta underscored. He never consulted with him /Gupta/, and even less with\n[Elamulam M.S.] Nambudiripad and G. Nair/ with the latter two only about using\nthe assistance/. All these matters were held in strictest secrecy from other\nleaders of the party and members of the National Council. This explains the\nfact that not a single report on this question has appeared in the press. Gupta\nsaid that he cannot singlehandedly take on responsibility in questions of\nassistance, therefore he considers it necessary to consult with Nambudiripad, whom\nhe characterized as a person of crystalline honesty and whom Ghosh trusted.\nGupta confidentially reported that A. Ghosh had not consulted on this problem\nwith Akhmed or with [Shripad Amrit] Dange, who once proposed that he entrust to\nhim alone all matters connected with the receipt of aid from abroad.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Mitrokhin Archive\nII:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"The Mitrokhin\nArchive\" refers to the collected notes taken by Vasili Mitrokhin over 30\nyears. They became public following his 1992 departure from Russia to Great\nBritain. The notes purportedly contain Soviet&nbsp;\nintelligence operations details obtained from KGB archives. Mitrokhin\nwas a Major&nbsp; and senior archivist for the\nUSSR's foreign intelligence service and the First Directorate of KGB. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In this he describes:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The CPI was funded in\nmany ways, including transfer of money through car windows on Delhi roads:\n\u201c(C.) Rajeshwar Rao, general secretary of the CPI from 1964 to 1990,\nsubsequently provided receipts for the sums received.\u201d <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Then there was the\ninfamous rupee-ruble trade: \u201cIn 1959, the CPI general secretary, Ajoy Ghosh,\nagreed on plans to found an import-export business for trade with the Soviet\nbloc, headed by a senior Party member codenamed DED...Within little more than a\ndecade its annual profits had grown to over 3 million rupees.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mrs Raj Thapar former\ncommunists of \"Thapar couple Fame:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mrs Raj Thapar former\ncommunists of \"Thapar couple\"' fame in her memoir \"All These\nYears (Penguin, 1991)\" writes \"To this day I cannot fathom what lay\nbehind the communist support for the idea of Pakistan, what vested interests\npossessed them to waste their cadres, their energy, to help what obviously the\nmost reactionary trend in our political life. &nbsp;And of all people, (Mohan\nKumaramangalam), who I then thought had devoured all the basic writings of\nMarxism, how could he hold, support, back and supply Jana was with the\nintellectual arguments he so urgently needed.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A Glimpse thru Mahatma\nGandhi's Letter<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">His letter to Communist\nleader P C joshi on June 11, 1944&nbsp; on How\nCommunist Betrayed Labour Leaders: Role of Communists was so illustrious that\neven Mahatma Gandhi got wind of their deeds.In his letter to Communist leader P\nC joshi on June 11, 1944 Gandhi himself talked about the Communist party\nhelping the authorities arrest the leaders of labor unions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"MY DEAR JOSHI, <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I had expected a prompt\nreply to the questions I had raised at our meeting. Meanwhile some additional\nquestions have arisen which please, answer when you answer my first questions. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1. What is the meaning\nof \u201cpeople\u201d in \u201cpeople\u2019s war\u201d? Does it mean war on behalf of India\u2019s millions,\nor the Negroes in East, South or West Africa, or the Negroes of America, or all\nof them? Are the Allies engaged in such a war? <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2. Are the finances of\nthe Communist Party, represented by you, subject to public audit? If they are,\nmay I see them? <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3. It is stated that\nthe Communist Party has actively helped the authorities to arrest leaders and\norganizers of labour strikes during the last two years. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4. The Communist Party\nis said to have adopted the policy of infiltrating the Congress organization\nwith a hostile intent. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">5. Is not the policy of\nthe Communist Party dictated from outside? <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yours sincerely, <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">M. K. GANDHI\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>(( GANDHI KNEW THAT\nROTHSCHILD INVNTED COMMUNISM AND ROTHSCHILD CONTROLLED INDIAN COMMIE LEADERS ,\nMOST OF WHOM WERE CRYPTO JEW. <o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: cyan;\">GANDHI HIMSELF WAS FROM\nKATIAWARI JAIN </b><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">CRYPTO JEW</b><b style=\"background-color: cyan;\"> COMMUNITY, SOME OF WHO ARE NOW BILLIONAIRES &nbsp;IN THE ANTWERP DIAMOND TRADE.&nbsp; ))</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://www.dnaindia.com/india/report-palanpuris-have-rivals-for-global-diamond-throne-1200102\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://www.dnaindia.com/india/report-palanpuris-have-rivals-for-global-diamond-throne-1200102</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In his reply on June\n14, 1944 P. C. Joshi does not deny the charge: He says it cannot be proven.\nThen gloats about this achievement of theirs:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"That we\nsuccessfully prevented the Indian working class from resorting to strikes even\nin a period of their worsening material conditions is the measure not only of\nour influence over it but its capacity to understand national interests as its\nown.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(Letter no 136, page\n100 and Appendix IX, page 444) <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">http://www.gandhiserve.org/cwmg/VOL084.PDF<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">How Communists acted as\nFifth Columnist for British:&nbsp; In an\nArticle article of V Sundaram&nbsp; Writes:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Bhulabhai Desai\nreported in the light of cold documentary evidence how the Communist Party of\nIndia had functioned as a fifth Columnist, acting as a paid agent of the\nBritish Government in India. His recommendations were referred to a Committee\nconsisting of Pandit Nehru, Sardar Patel and G B Pant who endorsed the findings\nof Bhulabhai Desai. Charge sheets were then served on the Communist\nmembers.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I WILL NOW REVEAL WHO\nIS KARAN THAPAR, ROMILA THAPAR ( JNU COMMIE PROFESSOR ) AND ROTHSCHILD\u2019S\nGENERAL , GEN PN THAPAR.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Romesh Thapar\n(1922\u20131987) was a commie journalist and political commentator. &nbsp;He was the founder-editor of the monthly\njournal Seminar, published from New Delhi, India.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Romesh Thapar was the brother\nof Romila Thapar, the JNU Commie professor whom I have trashed in the garbage\nbucket list. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; The scope of the pardoning power of the Indian President under\nArticle 72 is wider than the pardoning power of the state Governor under\nArticle 161.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Kisan Manifesto\nreleased in August 1936, demanded abolition of the zamindari system and in\nOctober 1937, it adopted red flag as its banner. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; He is popularly known as Comrade PS. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1934, Sundarayya\nbecame a member of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of India.\nDuring the same year, he became one of the founders of the All India Kisan\nSabha and was elected as its joint secretary.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">After Operation Polo\nwhen Telugu commies turned coat and started killing the Muslim landlords to grab\nlands , Sundarayya, was one of its leaders. He went underground between 1948\nand 1952 as Sardar Patel was after him.. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nehru arrested this\nChina supporting traitor in November 1962 at the time of India-China war.</span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Before Indian\nindependence Telugu communists got a foothold in Nizams kingdom only because of\nsponsorship by Jew Rothschild and the Nizam himself. They worked hand in glove\nwith Nizam\u2019s Razakars grabbing land from temples and Hindu landowners<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Why were Communists\nmovements confined to Warangal and Nalgonda districts only?&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These two districts\ndo not form even the entire Telangana.&nbsp;\nTelangana region comprises of 8 districts viz., 1. Warangal, 2.\nNalgonda, 3. Mahaboobnagar, 4. Medak, 5. Altraf Balda (present Hyderabad and\nRanga Reddy district), 6. Nizamabad, 7. Adilabad, 8. Karimnagar.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The commies had already\ninstigated the peasants to use guerrilla tactics against the Razakars and\naround 3000 villages (about 41000 km2) had come under peasant rule.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nlandlords were either killed or driven out and the land was redistributed.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nlandlords homes were burnt to destroy land records . Then the govt registry\nland officers were burnt .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Kothagudem mines\nprovided explosives . The communist Party had considerable influence&nbsp; among the workers there--like Comrade Seshagiri Rao. &nbsp;It used to get a\nlarge amount of gelignite sticks and necessary detonators which were used in\nthese operations as well as for making crude bombs. This source continued\nduring the fight against the Indian Union army after Operation Polo.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These victorious\nvillages established communes reminiscent of Soviet mirs to administer their\nregion. These community governments were integrated regionally into a central\norganization. The rebellion was led by the Communist Party of India under the\nbanner of Andhra Mahasabha.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The rising was probably\nthe longest lasting among the armed struggles in our country, extending for six\nyears approximately from October 1945&nbsp; to\nOctober 1951 (the time the Telangana armed struggle was declared to have been unconditionally\nwithdrawn).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hyderabad State was an\nIndian princely state which was ruled, from 1724 until 1948, by a hereditary\ncrypto Jew&nbsp; Nizam. The capital city was\nHyderabad.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Hyderabad state consisted of three linguistic areas, the eight\nTelugu-speaking districts with Hyderabad city, the capital of the state,\nconstituting the Telangana area; five Marathi-speaking districts, in the\nnorth-west of the state, constituting the Marathwada region; and three\nKannada-speaking districts in the south-western part.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Telangana region occupied 50 per cent of\nthe area, as against 28 per cent of the Marathwada region, and the remaining 22\nper cent of the Kannada region. The Telugu-speaking&nbsp; population in 1951 was 9,000,000 (50 per\ncent), Marathi-speaking about 4,500,000 (25 per cent) and Kannada-speaking\n2,000,000 (11 per cent) while the Urdu-speaking population was 2,100,000 (12\nper cent).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Imperial Bank of\nIndia opened a branch in Hyderabad in 1868, and a second branch in Secunderabad\nin 1906. Central Bank of India opened its branch in Hyderabad in 1918 and a\nsecond branch in Secunderabad in 1925\u2014both Rothschild owned banks.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A HEGELIAN DIAELECTIC\nwas done to create Telugu communism by Jew Rothschild.&nbsp; Much later Kamma actor NTR would again exploit \u201c\ntelugu pride \u201c to kickstart Telugu Desam Party become &nbsp;CM. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Rajiv Gandhi chided CM Anjaiah for spending\ntoo much money in welcomebanners and decorations. NTR used this as a Hegelian\ndialectic to tell Telugu peope that Anjaih was insulted by Rajiv Gangi and\nTelugu pride must be restored.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A triggering incident\nthat led to the kindling of Telugu people's self-respect in Hyderabad state\noccurred on 12 November 1921,in the Nizam state social conference when a Telugu\nlawyer Mr. Allampalli Venkata Rama Rao spoke in Telugu on a resolution,he was\nshouted by the audience who earlier spoke freely in English, Urdu and Marathi.&nbsp; This portrayed the true pariah position of\nTelugu language in the Nizam state.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is high time we abolished\nthe desh drohi Rajya Sabha.&nbsp; Thanks to\nRajya Sabha TV, the nation knows who the foreign payroll traitors MPs are.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Comrade Ajoy Kumar Ghosh, the then General\nSecretary of the Party, LIED in a meeting : &nbsp;He was the General Secretary of the Communist\nParty of India from 1951 till his death in 1962.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE \u201cBefore I\nconclude my speech, I will explain my opinion about the Telangana struggle.There\nis a section arguing that immediately after the entry of the Congress\nGovernment armies into Telangana, the armed peasant guerrilla struggle should\nhave been withdrawn. I consider it wrong to lay down arms immediately after the\nentry of the Indian Union armies. The issue that faced the Telangana peasant\nstruggle at that time was whether the peasantry that won land and democratic\nrights after a bitter struggle, were to surrender them without a fight and hand\nover the lands to the deshmukhs and to the landlords? Or were they to continue\narmed peasant guerrilla resistance to the extent necessary to defend them? In\nmy opinion, to continue the resistance is the revolutionary path and to lay\ndown arms is the path of betrayal of the people. \u201cAnother argument that is\nbrought out in support of withdrawal of armed guerrilla struggle at that time\nis that all the lands or a major portion of the land was seized back by the landlords\nand deshmukhs. Even if it was so, it is my firm opinion that on that ground to\nwithdraw the armed peasant guerrilla struggle is not correct. If we had\nwithdrawn the armed struggle, the peasantry would have considered that our\nParty leadership had betrayed them. In fact, it is in reality betrayal. Then\nwhat should we have done? What changes ought we to have made? It was wrong to\nfight with the object of establishing revolutionary people\u2019s power, for\noverthrowing of the Nehru Government, It should have continued as armed\nguerrilla struggle being waged by the peasantry, and for land to the peasantry.\nWhen the people still in general had illusions about the Nehru Government, to\ncontinue to fight with the immediate aim of overthrowing the Nehru Government\nwould not help to mobilise the broad masses of the people. That is why we\nshould have changed that slogan. Even if the enemy has been able to seize back\nall the land or a major portion of the land, the Telangana struggle has got\ntremendous revolutionary significance. We<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">have learnt great\nlessons from the Telangana struggle. One very important fact it has proved or\nbrought forth: that the Telangana peasant armed struggle has not only been able\nto fight the weak and demoralised Nizam\u2019s forces, but has also been able to\nfight the Congress Government\u2019s armed forces, well-equipped with modern weapons.\nThe Telangana peasants fought for three years against 30,000 to 50,000 armed personnel.\nEven after three years, the Government has not dared to say that it has been\nable to suppress it. So Telangana has blasted wrong conceptions that Nehru\u2019s\narmies are invincible (or are so strong that it is not possible to defeat\nthem). Thus, the Telangana peasant armed guerrilla struggle has demonstrated\nthe strength of peasants\u2019 guerrilla struggle and their revolutionary potentialities.\nIf the working class had joined hands with it, and in some other areas if the\npeasant struggles had reached that same level, we can imagine what great\ndevelopments might have occurred. This is the greatest lesson of our whole\nrevolutionary experience. These lessons we must study carefully. \u201cBut then\nanother question arises. When should it have been called off? I cannot just now\ndefinitely say as to exactly when it should have been withdrawn ...\u201d UNQUOTE <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: x-large; line-height: 150%;\"><b>BRRAAAYYYYYYYYYYYY !<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Must give the devil his\ndue. &nbsp;Bong&nbsp;Ajoy Ghosh supported India against\nChina during the Indian China war of 1962. &nbsp; Thank god for tender mercies.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The commies not only\ngrabbed land , killed the landlords , burnt their homes, burnt the land\nregistry govt offices-- they also found it necessary to kill all employees of\nthe land registry offices including retired employees ..&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">100% of the &nbsp;land registry office employee either were\nkilled or they just ran away.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">New GRAM RAJ&nbsp; committees (panch committees) were formed by\nthe commie leaders.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Men, women and leaders\nof village squads were elected to these committees, consisting<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">of five or seven\nmembers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Gram Raj Committees\nwarned landlords for fake cooked up crimes and officially levied fines. If the\nexhorbitant fines were NOT paid within a ridiculous deadline, their lands were\nconfiscated.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">POLICE STATION WERE\nWATCHED AND ANY LANDLORD WHO WENT TO FILE AN FIR IN THE POLICE STATION WAS\nKILLED. &nbsp;&nbsp;FALSE LAND DOCUMENTS WERE\nFORGED.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Commie historian\nLIE was \u201c The lands which were confiscated by the landlords and the\nmoney-lenders, even&nbsp; DECADES&nbsp; previously, under the pretext of loans not\npaid, under threats, or under the pretext of taxes not paid, or for some fines\nlevied under some false \u201ccharges\u201d, were returned to the original owners.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Landlords were not\nentitled to receive rent or compensation on these lands. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Why?&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The kauldar\u2019s (tenant\u2019s) land was\ndeclared to be his own. He did not have to pay&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">anything for apnaich </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">land, right ?.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE NEW LANDLORDS WERE\nTELUGU SPEAKING COMMIES \u2013WHO WERE PAUPERS BEFORE. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WE ALL KNOW WHO THESE COMMIES ARE\u2014MOST OF\nTHEM ARE NOW RICH LANDED LEADERS &nbsp;IN THE COMMUNIST,\nCONGRESS ,TDP AND TRS POLITICAL PARTIES.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MOST SHED THE COMMIE\nLOYALTY AFTER THEY GRABBED THE LANDS\u2014THE PEOPLE KNOW WHO THE NEUVO RICH\nEX-COMMIES ARE , WHO WERE PAUPERS BEFORE INDEPENDENCE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After Operation Polo,\nthe Razakars ( comrades in arms before-- &nbsp;now people\u2019s enemies &nbsp;) were deprived to the last acre of their\nlands. And all these were distributed to the people free. This took place in\nevery single village.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Example?-- In Suryapet\ntaluka, in 110 villages around Errapadu and Epuru, 20,000 acres of land belonging\nto the landlords were distributed. In all the 3,000 villages to which the\nmovement spread, 10 lakh acres of lands, surplus lands, anyakrantalu (illegally\nseized lands), leased lands, waste lands and porombokes, forest and grazing lands,\nwere distributed with full ownership rights to the rural poor and middle\npeasants. In Errapadu and Epuru areas itself, one lakh acres of Government land\nwere distributed. Along with the lands, the cattle belonging to the landlords\nwere also distributed to the people. The whole cattle herds of people\u2019s enemies\n( muslim landlords ) were completely taken over and distributed. Their number\nwas in tens of thousands. The cattle from one area were driven to another and\ndistributed, to prevent the enemies taking them back in case of raids. In Epuru\nand Errapadu areas alone, the cattle sent to other areas and distributed\namongst the people, came to more than 2,000. This will easily give one an idea\nas to how many cattle were distributed in the fighting areas of Telangana. Along\nwith the cattle, agricultural implements were also distributed to the people.\nThey had received goats and sheep also in good numbers. All these were free of\ncost.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IF I WRITE IN GREATER\nDETAIL MY POST WILL RUN INTO THOUSANDS OF PAGES.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Loans which were given\nto the people by landlords, deshmukhs and moneylenders were deleted by burning\nrecords. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Under the gram rajyams,\nthe commie cadre people received many other benefits. &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">There was no\ngovernment agent to collect taxes and the money remained with the people.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Toddy was sold at cheap\nprices to the peasants \u2013and they were asked NOT to pay any taxes to the govt.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This was appreciated by\nthe people and it brought about good results. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ALMOST ALL THE COMMIES\nBECAME DRUNKARDS BECAUSE OF FREE TODDY<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gram Raj Committees&nbsp; proclaimed and campaigned that men and women\nhad equal rights. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Commie atheist women were\nelected to Village Panch Committees&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE FAMILY STRUCTURE\nUNDER INDIAN CULTURE WAS ATTACKED AT THE ROOTS\u2014</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PEOPLE WITH ATTRACTIVE WIVES\nWERE KILLED AND IN THE NAME OF REHABILITATION OF WIDOWS THEY WERE MARRIED OFF\nTO OLD AND UGLY ATHEIST COMMIE LEADERS \u2013WHO ABANDONED OR KILLED THEIR PLAIN\nJANE FIRST WIVES<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Gram Committees settled\nall disputes NOT as per natural justice procedures, but only as per diktats of\nthe commie leaders.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ATHEIST COMMIES RULED\nTHE ROOST.&nbsp; &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SPIES REPORTED WHO ALL\nWENT TO TEMPLES AND THEY WOULD BE LITERALLY CHOKED OFF , TILL THEY BECAME\nATHEISTS OR CHRISTIANS .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Political propaganda\nused to be carried on extensively. Right from the Gram Committees, village\nsquads, to organisers and regular guerrilla squads, everyone used to explain\nevery problem in mass meetings. Along with this, there used to be many cultural\nitems, such as Burra Katha, Goilasuddulu (shepherds\u2019 sing-song) Yuyyala Pata\n(cradle songs), Kolatapupata (singsong dance with small wooden pieces in the\nhands of dancers which are used to produce rhythmic sounds)&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">HINDUS WERE MAIN\nTARGETS&nbsp; . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many songs were written\nabout every problem, about big incidents during the struggle, about the martyrs\nand about the atrocities of the enemy, their defeat, etc.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These LIES were not\nwritten by learned poets but had come from the ordinary people themselves in\nthe form of folk songs<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Local squads of atheist\ncommies took military training every day. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Here is an\nexample:&nbsp; In Chilapakunta village in\nSuryapet taluka, these cowherd boys were once enacting a drama. One of them had\nbecome Janna Reddy Pratap Reddy, the vicious landlord and another one a\nnotorious Razakar, Abbas Ali, and the rest of the boys were guerrillas. The\nactors who played the port of the landlords were badly mauled and blinded by\ndrunken commies .. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An adult literacy programme\nwas taken up and carried on- IT WAS MAINLY ANTI-HINDU PROPAGANDA <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MONEY STOLEN FROM\nMURDERED LANDLORDS HOUSES WERE BURIED UNDER THE GROUND \u2013EVEN TODAY SUCH BURIED\nGOLD ORNAMENTS ARE FOUND BY PEOPLE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They hid their\nexplosives , grains and money in the grain pits scattered all over the fields\nto prevent them from falling into the hands of the enemy. There &nbsp;this trade that some essential raw material\nfor making gunpowder or even crude bombs could be gathered. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">MINES WERE WELL STOCKED\nWITH&nbsp;</span><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">EXPLOSIVES</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;IMPORTED FROM COMMUNIST CHINA<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Telugu commies has\nsuffered shattering losses during the Indian military backlash after Operation\nPolo from 1948-51. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cEvery bit of property,\nsupplies, articles, jewellery or cash confiscated from the enemies\u2019 houses were\nmeticulously accounted for, and forwarded to the higher committee \u201c---. This is\ncommie historian\u2019s pathetic bullshit.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cThere was no laying\nhands on women or molestation of women, no maltreatment of old<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">men even belonging to\nthe enemy \u201c &nbsp;&nbsp;THIS IS A LIE \u2013 <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE COMMIE&nbsp;</span><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">GUERRILLAS</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;RAPED ALMOST ALL THE &nbsp;ATTRACTIVE YOUNG\nMUSLIM WOMEN\u2014A LOT OF OF THEM RAN TO NEIGHBOURING KARNATAKA <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
